title: Dynamic Music Layering
description: Dynamically add and remove musical layers based on gameplay events. Easy to setup and comes with video tutorial.
longDescription:
A drag-and-drop blueprint for adding and removing music layers based on gameplay events (such as overlaps.)


i.e. allows sound designers to create changes in mood and/or increasing intensity by adding new musical layers as a player progresses through a game.


Beginner friendly, easy to integrate, and includes a step-by-step video tutorial.


Setup

Demo and setup: https://youtu.be/p79ZDJrftAI


FAQ

Where do I go for support?

  • Slightly Esoteric Game Development Discord. We have an active community full of friendly members who are familiar with the asset and how to troubleshoot common issues.

How do I set it up?

  • See the step-by-step tutorial on YouTube (above).

I'm new to Unreal, is it hard to use?

  • No. This asset has been built with the intention to be easily setup and reused by beginners to Unreal. It comes with a step-by-step setup tutorial video on YouTube, and Discord community for troubleshooting.

Is it difficult to integrate into a pre-existing project?

  • No. This asset was designed to be integrated into projects as easily as possible.

What happens if there is an update? Do I need to purchase again?

  • No. A single purchase means lifetime access.

Does it work with custom music?

  • Yes. Any music that can be imported into Unreal will work with this asset.

Do I get my money back if there's something wrong?

  • Yes. See Epic's refund policy.

I have other questions before I purchase, who do I contact?

  • You can contact Jackson on Discord, or ask in the server.
technicalDetails:
Features:

  • Supports custom music
  • Supports an endless number of layers
  • Includes drag and drop overlap volumes to play/mute music layers when a player starts or ends overlap
  • Includes two example maps with two sets of sample music

Number of Blueprints: 3

Network Replicated: No

Supported Development Platforms: All
